chunks.heading: Part B Definitions
chunks.section_path: SPACE FOR ENDORSEMENTS > Part B Definitions

entities.name: Carcinoma-in-situ
entities.description: A histologically proven, localized pre-invasion lesion where cancer cells have not yet penetrated the basement membrane or invaded surrounding tissues.

entities.name: TNM Staging
entities.description: A classification method for tumors, including Carcinoma-in-situ.

entities.name: FIGO
entities.description: Staging method of the Federation Internationale de Gynecologie et d'Obstetrique.

relations.evidence: where the tumour is classified as Tis according to the TNM Staging method.
For purposes of this Policy, Carcinoma-in-situ must be confirmed by a biopsy.

chunks.heading: Early Stage Cancer
chunks.section_path: SPACE FOR ENDORSEMENTS > Part B Definitions > Early Stage Cancer

entities.name: Early Stage Cancer
entities.description: The presence of one of the following malignant conditions: Tumour of the thyroid histologically classified as T1N0M0, Prostate tumour classified as TNM T1a, T1b, or T1c, Chronic lymphocytic leukaemia classified as RAI Stage I or II, Basal cell and squamous skin cancer that has spread to distant organs, Hodgkin's lymphoma Stage I.

entities.name: Major Cancer
entities.description: A malignant tumour characterised by the uncontrolled growth & spread of malignant cells with invasion & destruction of normal tissues.

relations.evidence: Early Stage Cancer shall mean the presence of one of the following malignant conditions: ... (iii) Chronic lymphocytic leukaemia classified as RAI Stage I or II; ...

chunks.heading: Pre-existing Disease
chunks.section_path: SPACE FOR ENDORSEMENTS > Part B Definitions > Pre-existing Disease

entities.name: Pre-existing Disease
entities.description: Any condition, ailment, injury or disease diagnosed by a physician within 48 months prior to the effective date of the policy.

entities.name: Policyholder
entities.description: The individual who takes the policy and chooses the plan options.

entities.name: Cancer Diagnosis Benefit
entities.description: A lump sum benefit paid on diagnosis of cancer.

relations.evidence: The benefits covered under the policy are determined by the Plan Option chosen by the Policyholder.
A lump sum benefit, as per the table below, will be paid on diagnosis of: - Carcinoma-in-situ or Malignant cancer

entities.name: Premium Guarantee
entities.description: The Premiums shall remain unchanged for a period of three years from the date of issuance of Policy.

entities.name: IRDAI
entities.description: Any revision in the Premium rates shall be notified to you at least three months prior to the date of such revision and you will be given a period of 30 days from Premium Due Date to renew the Policy.

relations.evidence: Upon the completion of three Policy years, the Premiums may be revised by us subject to IRDAI's approval.

chunks.heading: 2. Revival of the Policy

entities.description: The individual whose health evidence is required for policy revival.

relations.evidence: Currently, the application for the revival should be made within five years from the due date of the first unpaid Premium and before the expiry of the Policy Term. The revival will be subject to satisfactory evidence of good health being provided by the Life Assured and payment of outstanding Premiums with interest.

chunks.heading: Section 38 - Assignment or Transfer of Insurance Policies

entities.name: Insurer
entities.description: The entity that must receive notice of transfer or assignment.

entities.name: Policyholder
entities.description: The individual who holds the insurance policy and may be affected by the insurer's decisions.

entities.name: IRDAI
entities.description: The authority to which claims can be preferred in case of refusal by the insurer.

relations.evidence: The transfer or assignment shall not be operative as against an insurer until a notice in writing of the transfer or assignment and either the said endorsement or instrument itself or copy thereof certified to be correct by both transferor and transferee or their duly authorised agents have been delivered to the insurer.
In case of refusal to act upon the endorsement by the Insurer, any person aggrieved by the refusal may prefer a claim to IRDAI within 30 days of receipt of the refusal letter from the Insurer.

relations.evidence: The provisions of Section 39 are not applicable to any life insurance policy to which Section 6 of Married Women's Property Act, 1874 applies or has at any time applied except where before or after Insurance Laws (Amendment) Act, 2015, a nomination is made in favour of spouse or children or spouse and children whether or not on the face of the policy it is mentioned that it is made under Section 39.

No Insurer shall repudiate a life insurance Policy on the ground of Fraud, if the Insured / beneficiary can prove that the misstatement was true to the best of his knowledge and there was no deliberate intention to suppress the fact or that such mis-statement of or suppression of material fact are within the knowledge of the insurer.
...no life insurance policy would have been issued to the insured.
